description: Complete visual overhaul inspired by Jony Ive's minimalism and Superhuman's speed-first UX. Strip away clutter, elevate typography, unify auth flows, and create a casino that feels like Apple designed it.

designPhilosophy.core: Less, but better. Every pixel earns its place.

principles.radicalSimplicity: If it doesn't help you place a bet or see results, remove it
principles.typographyFirst: Type is the primary design element. No decorative borders or boxes.
principles.whiteSpace: Generous breathing room creates elegance. Cramped is never luxurious.
principles.oneAction: ONE primary action per screen state. Everything else fades back.
principles.instantFeedback: Every interaction responds in <100ms with spring physics
principles.keyboardFirst: Power users should never need the mouse

phases.name: Typography & Visual Foundation
phases.description: Replace generic fonts with premium typography. Establish clear visual hierarchy through type alone.

phases.name: Declutter Game Views
phases.description: Strip redundant elements from BlackjackView, BaccaratView, and all game screens. One place for each piece of information.

phases.name: Bet Controls Revolution
phases.description: Redesign bet buttons and chip selectors. Make placing bets feel instant and satisfying.

phases.name: Auth & Passkey Simplification
phases.description: Remove authentication complexity from user consciousness. It should just work.

phases.name: Navigation & Menu Refinement
phases.description: Simplify navigation. Remove drawer overload. One way to do each thing.

phases.name: Premium Polish
phases.description: Final touches that elevate from good to luxurious.

stories.title: Implement premium font stack with SF Pro and Inter
stories.description: Replace system fonts with Inter for UI and SF Pro Display/JetBrains Mono for numbers. Typography should feel expensive.
acceptance: Inter loaded via Google Fonts or local files
SF Pro Display used for headlines (fallback to system-ui)
JetBrains Mono used ONLY for balance displays and numeric values
Font weights limited to 400 (normal), 500 (medium), 600 (semibold)
No font-bold (700) anywhere except hero headlines
Letter-spacing tightened for headlines (-0.02em)
Build passes, fonts render correctly
implementation: Add Inter font import to index.css or tailwind config
Update design-tokens TYPE_SCALE with new font families
Create text-display-mono class for balance/bet amounts
Audit all font-bold usages, replace with font-semibold
Set default letter-spacing: -0.01em on body
Test on Windows/Linux where SF Pro unavailable
stories.notes: Superhuman uses Inter. Apple uses SF Pro. Linear uses Inter. These are the gold standards.

stories.title: Establish 4-level typography hierarchy
stories.description: Create strict typography hierarchy: Hero (48px), Headline (24px), Body (16px), Caption (12px). No in-between sizes.
acceptance: TYPE_SCALE reduced to 4 core sizes + 1 micro (10px)
Hero: 48px/56px, -0.02em, font-semibold
Headline: 24px/32px, -0.015em, font-medium
Body: 16px/24px, normal, font-normal
Caption: 12px/16px, 0.01em, font-normal, text-titanium-500
Remove text-bodyLarge, text-headingLarge confusion
All game views use only these 4 sizes
implementation: Simplify TYPE_SCALE in design-tokens
Create semantic classes: text-hero, text-headline, text-body, text-caption
Audit all components for non-standard sizes
Replace text-sm, text-xs, text-lg with semantic classes
Document hierarchy in design-principles.md
stories.notes: Constraint breeds creativity. Limiting to 4 sizes forces intentional decisions.

stories.title: Reduce color palette to essential shades

acceptance: TITANIUM reduced to: 50 (background), 100 (surface), 200 (border), 600 (text-muted), 900 (text-primary)
Remove titanium-300, 400, 500, 700, 800 intermediate shades
ACTION colors: keep only indigo, success (green), destructive (red)
Remove action-warning, action-info duplicates
All components use semantic color names, not numbered shades
Create semantic aliases: bg-primary, bg-surface, border-default, text-muted
implementation: Audit current color usage across all components
Update design-tokens/colors.ts with reduced palette
Create semantic color mapping in Tailwind extend
Search-replace titanium-300/400/500/700/800 usages
Update dark mode mappings for 5-shade system
stories.notes: Apple's interfaces use surprisingly few colors. The contrast creates hierarchy, not color variety.

stories.title: Remove decorative borders and boxes
stories.description: Eliminate visual noise from borders, rounded boxes, and decorative containers. Let typography and spacing create structure.
acceptance: Remove border classes from inline info displays
Remove bg-titanium-50/100 wrapper divs that add visual weight
Bet pills become pure text with subtle color, no border
Card totals become clean numbers without badge containers
Reduce rounded-* usage to only interactive elements (buttons, cards)

implementation: Audit BlackjackView.tsx for border/bg wrapper divs
Audit BaccaratView.tsx for same
Replace badge-style displays with clean typography
Use spacing (gap/padding) instead of borders for separation
Keep borders only on: buttons, modals, drawers, cards
stories.notes: Jony Ive: 'We try to develop products that seem somehow inevitable.' Borders make things feel constructed, not inevitable.

stories.title: Redesign RegistrationView with luxury aesthetic
stories.description: RegistrationView has old terminal-green-on-black aesthetic. Modernize to match new design language.
